data.title: Upscale Italian Eatery
data.text: Excellent food,service (Thank you Denise) and decor. Some of the young wait staff could tone down conversations.  This restaurant replaced the Ingelnook. House wines by the glass were excellent and available in the wine shop next door. We will be back.

data.title: The Experience Fell Short of the Decore
data.text: Your hopes rise upon entering. The room is well appointed and pleasing. It's a cut above what you expect to find in Loveland. Little do you know that's the highlight of your evening. Rarely have I encountered such poor service. For 3 of the 4 in our party, dishes were handled to us; they weren't placed on the table before us despite our hesitancy to accepting the handoff. Entree orders were not even taken until we finished our first course and awaited for some time. A menu and wine list were left, leaving me with no choice but to place them on the floor to free up much needed table space. My one campion said he pasta and meatballs were good. He's the only one of the 4 of us who complimented the cuisine. Another, who also got pasta (different dish), said it was good but not great. The other two were clearly disappointed (gnudi and a chicken dish). All and all, this was a disappointing experience at a restaurant that seems to have potential but has quite a ways to go before realizing that potential.

data.title: Very good, but there is room for improvement
data.text: We have been to Slate 3 times now. Service is always fabulous. Wine selection and prices great, cocktails excellent, but I am bored with the menu at this point. It is small, with delicious, but limited items (the mussels are to die for)They need to update or edit at this point. I appreciate that they offer zucchini spirals as a gluten free option and they are great with some of the lighter sauces, but I really wish they would get an actual gluten free pasta so I could try some of the other delicious sauces. Maybe even consider adding a risotto. I'm not celiac, but limit my intake. My choices at Slate have been exhausted.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
Visited Slate for Lunch OCtober21, 2016:   The service, friendly though, but VERY slow.
Food was NOT hot, one item ordered never came ( forgotten ? ) !
The menu was good, as was the soup and salad. the restaurant decor was VERY nice, the priced menu was in line with other, but a charge applied to   bread served with
Balsamic and Oil to dip in.  The water was free, the wines are all Italien, not a great choice for a more rebust Red Wine.

data.title: Nice atmosphere and great food
data.text: We took a friend there as a thank you gesture.  We enjoyed the Cheese Slate appetizer, macaroni and crab, BLT panini and Apple panini.  All were fresh and tasted great.

data.title: Small revisions to menu could make it great
data.text:
I was quite excited to visit this new restaurant in downtown Loveland. I was quite pleased with the meat and cheese tray as well as a blood orange martini I started with. My dish, carbonara, was delicious. It was not smothered in cream but quite full of flavor. A friend ordered the chicken Parm ,and it was also quite good. The Side of polenta was also good. Made from scratch and not too heavy. On the other hand my husband ordered macaroni Verde. It was boring and bland. It was basically penne with pesto. This dish definitely need some work. Another friend got the eggplant Parmesan and was also not very pleased with it.

The service was good and the wait staff was friendly.

So small changes to the menu could make this an excellent place.

data.title: Excellent food and service in a quiet setting
data.text: We had an excellent lunch and great service in a quiet setting. I ordered the chicken Parmesan, and it was fixed to perfection--lightly breaded, crisp, tender and juicy inside with a flavorful marinara. My husband had the calamari fennel salad, and he thought it had great flavor. We had tiramisu and ice cream vin cotto for dessert. They were both made in-house and were excellent. We've already planned a return visit.

data.title: From scratch Italian
data.text: Nice selection of Italian dishes, not the Americanized versions (no lasagna). Large portions. We had a party of 9 and 8 really liked their meals. Nice wine list and full bar service available. Soup of the day, Italian chicken was very good. Wait staff seemed to be on a bit of a learning curve but very friendly. A little on the small side but that tended to add to the pleasant atmosphere.

data.title: Could be great
data.text: Loved the location and ambience but the service was just ok (I think the server was on her first day) and some entrees were very good some very bland. New restaurant so would like to cut them some slack and will try again.

data.title: Great experience
data.text:
Met friends for dinner and greatly enjoyed Slate.  Service was friendly and accommodating - recommendations were spot on. 
The food was incredible!  Best Italian we've had in a while.  Friends had the chicken parmigiana and it looked delicious.  Our carbonara with homemade pasta was perfect. 
Great tiramisu and canolli!

data.title: Quaint and Classy
data.text: Small, creative menu, nice wine selection.  Soothing ambience - casual chic.  Nice choice for a special outing

data.title: "New on the scene in Loveland, Keep up the good work"
data.text: Slate is new on the scene in Loveland, and a very Bright new addition. There menu is not super extensive but what they do serve is excellent, great flavors and just right portions and a wine list that pairs very well. The owner stopped by our table to check on our experience and you can tell that pride and a level of commitment in this business. Keep up the great food and service!

data.title: Great place to enjoy a meal with the wife!!
data.text: Excellent service (Waitress was Rachel and she was fantastic) paired well with excellent food and a great ambience.  I recommend Slate and will return on a regular basis. Almost forgot, great wine list to.

data.title: Much needed Italian
data.text:
Good and authentic Italian....which is hard to find in northern Colorado. Great service and server was willing to ask chef my gluten free questions. Chef willingly substituted polenta in my dish to prepare it gluten free. There was no gf pasta, but offered zucchini  spirals in place of noodles. 
Wine list so so, but my guess is it will get better. Slate only open one month when we visited. 
All in all a fun evening out. No complaints. We will go back.

data.title: Exceptional Italian food...lovely ambience
data.text:
Love, love, love this new addition to Loveland.  

The ambience is truly lovely.  Seating is intimate.  Restaurant is beautifully decorated.  The dining area is really nice, but does have limited seating, also a very small bar area with seating.  There is a sideroom for larger parties if you need seating that is greater than four.  There are also small areas outside of the main dining area that are perfect for special occasions.  I would recommend reservations if visiting on a weekend. 

Food is exceptional.  We ordered drinks, an appetizer to share, salads, dinner and dessert.  We were there for our anniversary, and were dining with family.  Everything was exceptional.  Decadent.  Food is Italian, so on the rich side (flavor), but wonderful flavor profiles and food combinations. 

Thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant from start to finish, from seating to dessert. 

Would highly recommend. 

Portions are generous so be prepared to take a to-go box. Also, as a vegetarian, there are lots of options, which was great to see. 

We will definitely return.

data.title: Great New Italian Eatery in Downtown Loveland
data.text:
My husband and I were lured in thanks to the dining coupon we had received in the mail.  We love Italian cuisine and love downtown Loveland instead of trekking all the way to downtown FOCO, so we were excited to try something new.  

We had the mussels as an appetizer and they were FANTASTIC.  Fresh and not dried out -- the sauce that they come in could be an app on its own, it is so good.  I am gluten free so was glad to hear that they had zucchini spiral pasta that I could have with their various sauces.  I chose the swordfish picata and replaced the orzo with the zucchini spirals.  It was excellent.  For those of us who are gluten free, it would be nice to have a gluten free bread option and/or some actual pasta (rice flour pasta is great) to chose from.

My husband hand the pork belly.  This would be the only complaint that we had.... We know that pork belly is a fatty cut and that you should expect a balance of meat an crispy fat if cooked well.  You wouldn't expect to be served entire cuts of fat.  The pieces that were a balance of meat and fat were good, but two pieces were entirely fat an not edible.

Service at the door, bar and table was excellent.  We will be back to try more even without a coupon.

data.title: Great food,  seating not so great
data.text:
We had a reservation but were seated in the"party" room. One reason wet enjoyed this restaurant was because of the intimate seating and the quiet atmosphere. 
It was very noisy in this room and there were several tables available in the main dining room.
We enjoyed our food and had a wonderful wait staff but didn't want to linger because of the noise level. We'll try again.

data.title: Some good, some not so
data.text:
Our first visit to The Slate was to celebrate a birthday. We love the ambiance...new décor is tastefully done, and the white linen gives it an upscale feel. Service was excellent and friendly, but a little too speedy...even though we arrived at 7:00, and there were tables available throughout our stay, we had the feeling we were being hurried through our dinner...salad served along with appetizer, main course served before we were completely finished with our salad, etc. The appetizer of prosciutto and melon was excellent, and our house Caesar was tasty, with tiny peppers that were a happy addition. Main courses: I ordered the appetizer size calamari (unbreaded and very good, but my husband's order of eggplant parmigiana was one of the worst he had ever eaten, and it is usually a favorite of his...thick and dry. The side cauliflower was very good however. I received a complimentary dessert to celebrate my birthday...ice cream with a wine reduction topping that was to die for. My husband ordered the Tiramisu, and  it was not exceptional, but acceptable. 
We will be back to try again...order some other selections that might be more to our liking. We would love for this place to be great. We need a good Italian restaurant in Loveland. Price was definitely reasonable...good for going to even if it isn't a special occasion.

data.title: Disappointed in the food
data.text:
My wife and I went to Slate, a new Italian restaurant in downtown Loveland.  We went for dinner on Friday evening, during Night on the Town.  The restaurant has a classy, yet casual, comfortable feel, which is enhanced by the friendly and attentive staff.  Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the food.  My wife had eggplant parmigiana, which is one of her favorites.  This dish is usually prepared with layered thinly sliced eggplant, but this one was made with two individual thick slices, which detracted from the meal.  It was served with polenta, which was too dry, and roasted cauliflower, which was very good.  I ordered cioppino, which had plenty of clams, mussels and calamari, but which was lacking any swordfish, which the menu mentioned.  The broth was very salty, a definite drawback to this dish.  For dessert, we shared cannolis, which were served drizzled with dark chocolate, and were quite good.  I asked for decaf coffee, and was informed that they had none (I don’t know if this was a temporary or permanent situation).  The prices for the meals were very reasonable.
Downtown Loveland could benefit from a good Italian restaurant, and the location could help draw people off of 4th Street to some of the other nearby businesses.  A bit of tweaking to the preparation could make this a great addition to Loveland.

data.title: Outstanding Food and Service
data.text:
We tried the Slate Italian Eatery recently to celebrate a special occasion, and we were not disappointed. As mentioned here in Trip Advisor, this is a new restaurant in downtown Loveland, CO. The restaurant is locally owned and managed, and the attention to detail was reflective of this throughout our meal.

The atmosphere was relaxed, yet modern, and we were greeted promptly upon entering the restaurant. Although we dined during the lunch rush during the week, we were seated without delay. 

All food is prepared fresh daily and made from scratch, including the pasta, and this was quite obvious, whether you took your first bite of food, or your last. We started out with the Fennel Salami Bruschetta, followed by a Three Bean cup of soup and small Caesar Salad. Our entrees consisted of the Lunch Bolognese and Chicken Parmesan, and we finished with desserts of Tiramisu and Blueberry Trifle. 

Lunch portions are smaller than most fine dining restaurants, which was perfect for us. Our server, Ashley, was superb, very attentive, and she took her time explaining the menu and answering all of our questions when we told her this was our first visit to the Slate.  

Bottom line: We will surely return to the Slate again, next time for dinner.
